Dear Jennifer Lynn Trotter:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Incident reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150
Section (3) If an institution determines that a youth is absent without legal
Description permission, then the institution shall immediately report the
information to law enforcement, the parent/ legal guardian or next
of kin, the licensing authority, and the referring agency.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility had 3 AWOLS that were not reported timely between
January 2022 and August 2023. They also reported 5 Emergency
Assistance requiring Law Enforcement, 1/29/2022, 6/7/2023,
8/29/2023,10/20/2023, and 1/26/2024. One incident as
Emergency Assistance 11/11/2022. All incidents were input into
MiSACWIS on 3/21/2024 and approved on the same date.
Investigation Interviews:
On 04/11/2024 an onsite visit occurred to Girlstown by DCWL 2.
An in-person meeting was held with Program Manager(PM). She
was advised that a special investigation was being initiated and
advised of the allegations. DCWL 2 advised PM of the assigned
consultant for the investigation.
On 04/15/2024 contact was made with complainant. No additional
concerns were noted.
On 04/15/2024 collateral contact was made with the assigned
worker, DCWL Consultant 3. She provided an update regarding
the agency and their level of compliance over the last few years.
She expressed no concerns regarding the agency. She also
confirmed receipt of documents sent for review relative to program
statement, Absent With Out Leave (AWOL) Policy and Critical
Incident Policies of the agency.
On 04/20/2024 an in-person interview was held with PM at
Girlstown. She advised the agency had unfortunately failed to
report three previous AWOL incidents to DCWL timely and failed
to enter the incidents into the Michigan Statewide Automated
Child Welfare Information System (MiSACWIS). PM confirmed
that law enforcement, parents and the assigned worker were
notified. PM further added that the agency had no excuse as to
why additional required tasks were not completed. She reported
the agency has begun to appropriately input AWOL and other
critical incidents into MiSACWIS.
Documents reviewed:
Girlstown AWOL Policy indicated AWOLP is defined as a child
who is placed with an agency for care and supervision and who is
absent from an approved placement without legal permission.
Girlstown Critical Incident Policy indicated it is the policy of the
agency to document and report all Critical Incidents. Reportable
Critical Incidents are defined as: f. Missing
2

Person/AWOL/Elopement/Wandering and k. Law Enforcement
Contact. Critical incidents must be reported to MDHHS through
MiSACWIS as required by contract and/or licensing.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, there was sufficient
information to confirm non-compliance with licensing rule 4150-3.
During the interview with the program manager, she confirmed the
agency had failed to report AWOL and other critical incidents to
the licensing authority and did not report them in MiSACWIS prior
to 3/21/2024 as required.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
